Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in law by applying the residency test from Re Pourghasemi instead of Koo
Application_Facts: Applicant had discrepancies in residency evidence, including conflicting addresses and unclear living arrangements
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application rejected due to lack of credible residency evidence
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Citizenship Court decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; original decision upheld
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged legal error in applying residency test
Legal_Standard: Quantitative test (Re Pourghasemi) vs. qualitative test (Koo) for residency
Assessment_Factor: Credibility and consistency of residency evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Residency evidence found insufficient and inconsistent
Application_Basis: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical residency requirement over four years
Evidence_Assessed: Conflicting addresses, unclear duration and nature of residence
Governing_Rule: Residency must be established under either quantitative (Pourghasemi) or qualitative (Koo) test
Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; decision to deny citizenship upheld
Cause_Description: Lack of credible evidence to prove required physical residency in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Residency evidence scrutinized for consistency and plausibility
Evidence_Issues: Discrepancies in address reporting and lack of supporting documentation
Residency_Compliance: Failed to demonstrate 1,095 days of physical presence
Evidence_Assessment: Findings of insufficient and inconsistent evidence to establish residency
Decision_Rationale: Judge's application of law was reasonable; outcome within acceptable range
Evidentiary_Issues: Conflicting information on place of residence and duration
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard on judicial review; residency test under Pourghasemi/Koo
